lines.gurmukhi: 1 mMglwcrn, gurU
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Onkaar,the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: siq rUp guru drsno pUrn bHm Acrju idKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Roop Guru Darasano Pooran Brahamu Acharaju Dikhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The glimpse of the Guru (Nanak Dev) is in the form of truth which has brought me face to face with the perfect and wondrous

lines.gurmukhi: siqnwmu krqw purKu pwrbHmu prmysru iDAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Naamu Karataa Purakhu Paarabrahamu Paramaysaru Dhiaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bestowing upon the people the mantra of true Name and the creator Lord, he has made the people remember the transcendent B

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur sbd igAwnu scu Anhd Duin ivsmwdu suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sabad Giaanu Sachu Anahad Dhouni Visamaad Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The knowledge of truth is the Word of the Guru, through which the wonder inspiring unstruck melody is heard.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQu clwieEnu nwmu dwnu iesnwnu diRVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pandu Chalaaiaonu Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Initiating the gurmukh-panth, (Sikhism, the highway for gurmukhs) the Guru inspired one and all to be steadfastly absorbed

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK dy gur isK kir swDsMgiq scuKMfu vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhu Day Gurasikh Kari Saadhasangati Sachu Khandu Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Educating the people and making them his disciples, the Gum has founded holy congregation, the abode of truth.

lines.gurmukhi: scu rwis rhrwis dy siqgur isK dy pYrI pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Raas Raharaasi Day Satigur Gurasikh Pairee Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Handing over the capital of truth to the people, the Guru made them bow at the (lotus) feet (of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl pRqwp jxwieAw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Parataapu Janaaiaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: He made people understand the glory of the feet (of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: 2 qIrQ swDU

Shabad OS B.translation: Pilgrimage centres and sadhus

lines.gurmukhi: qIrQ nHwqY pwp jwin piqq auDwrx nwau DrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Teerad Nhaatai Paap Jaani Patit Udhaaran Naaoun Dharaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Since the sins are obliterated at the pilgrimage centres, people have ven them the Name of uplifters of the fallen ones.

lines.gurmukhi: qIrQ hon skwrQy swD jnwN dw drsn pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Teerad Hon Sakaaraday Saadh Janaan Daa Darasanu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But pilgrimage centres ecome meaningful only by the sight of the sadhus there.

lines.gurmukhi: swD hoey mn swiDkY crx kvl gur iciq vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Hoay Man Saadhi Kai Charan Kaval Gur Chiti Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sadhus are they, ho having disciplined the mind have put it in the lotus feet of the Guru. ory of sadhu is unfathomable and

lines.gurmukhi: aupmw swD AgwiD boD kot mDy ko swDu suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Oupamaa Saadh Agaadhi Bodh Kot Madhay Ko Saadhu Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One out of crores may be d to be a (true) sadhu.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK swD AsMK jig Drmswl Qwie Qwie suhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Saadh Asankh Jagi Dharamasaal Daai Daai Suhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: However sadhus in the form of the Sikhs of Guru anak) are innumerable because the dharamscias, holy centres, flourish erywh

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pYr Dovxy crxodku lY pYru pujwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Pair Dhovanay Charanodaku Lai Pairu Pujaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: People bowing at the feet of the Sikhs of the Guru take wash ectar of their feet and worship the same.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu AlKu lKwieAw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh has had the glimpse the imperceptible Lord and pleasure fruit there of.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 DUVI

Shabad OS B.translation: Dust

lines.gurmukhi: pMij qq auqpiq kr gurmuiK DrqI Awpu gvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Panji Tat Outapati Kari Guramoukhi Dharatee Aapu Gavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cultivating the virtues of all the five elements in their hearts, the gurmukhs like earth have lost the sense of ego.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl srxwgqI sB inDwn sBy Pl pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Saranaagatee Sabh Nidhaan Sabhay Phal Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They have come to the shelter of the Guru's feet and from that store - house they get all sorts of benefits.

lines.gurmukhi: lok vyd gur igAwn ivic swDU DUiV jgqu qrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lok Vayd Gur Giaan Vichi Saadhoo Dhoorhi Jagat Taraaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From convention and the knowledge given by the Guru also the same (conclusion) emerges that the dust of the (feet of) sadh

lines.gurmukhi: piqq punIq krwiekY pwvn purK pivqR krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Patit Pouneet Karaai Kai Paavan Purakh Pavitr Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fallen ones are made meritorious and the meritorious ones are further transformed into sacred ones.

lines.gurmukhi: crxodk mihmw Aimq syK shs muiK AMqu n pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Charanodak Mahimaa Amit Saykh Sahas Moukhi Antu N Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The glory of the wash nectar of the feet of sadhus is limitless; even Stesanag (thouosand hooded mythological snake) while

lines.gurmukhi: DUVI lyKu imtwieAw crxodk mnu visgiq AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhoorhee Laykhu Mitaaiaa Charanodak Manu Vasigati Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eulogizing the Lord by its many a mouth could not know it. The dust of sadhu's feet has erased all debts and because of that feet-wash nectar, the mind has also come under control.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY jgu crnI lwieAw ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Jagu Charanee Laaiaa ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh first himself bowed at the feet and then he made the whole world fall at his feet.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 gMgw dy diRStwNq qoN aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Teachings from the example of Ganges

lines.gurmukhi: crxodku hoie sursrI qij bYkuMT Driq ivic AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Charanodaku Hoi Surasaree Taji Baikountd Dharati Vichi Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ganges, the wash of the Lords' feet, left heavens and came down to arth.

lines.gurmukhi: nau sY ndI niVMnvY ATsiT qIriQ AMig smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Sai Nadee Narhinnavai Atdasatdi Teeradi Angi Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nine hundred ninety nine rivers and sixty eight pilgrimage centres erged in it.

lines.gurmukhi: iqhu loeI prvwxu hY mhwdyv lY sIs cVHweI
lines.transliteration_english: Tihu Loee Paravaanu Hai Mahaadayv Lai Sees Charhhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In all the three worlds, it is accepted as authentic and Mahadev ,iva) has borne it on his head.

lines.gurmukhi: dyvI dyv sryvdy jY jY kwr vfI vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvee Dayv Sarayvaday Jai Jai Kaar Vadee Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gods and goddesses all worship it and hail s greatness.

lines.gurmukhi: sxu gMgw bYkuMT lK lK bYkuMT nwiQ ilv lweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sanu Gangaa Baikountd Lakh Lakh Baikountd Naadi Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriads of heavens and the master of heavens including the ranges, absorbed in meditation declare,

lines.gurmukhi: swDU DUiV dulMB hY swDsMgiq siqguru srxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhoo Dhoorhi Dulabh Hai Saadhasangati Satiguru Saranaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: That the dust of the feet of sadhu is rare and is obtainable only by coming under the shelter of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl dl kIm n pweI ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Dal Keem N Paaee ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Value of even the one petal of the lotus feet is beyond assessment.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 gurmuKwN dy suK Pl dI vifAweI

Shabad OS B.translation: Grandeur of the pleasure -fruit of gurmukhs

lines.gurmukhi: crx srix ijsu lKmI lK klw hoie lKI n jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Jisu Lakhamee Lakh Kalaa Hoi Lakhee N Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lakhs of invisible powers adorn the shelter of the feet of goddess of wealth (Laksmi);

lines.gurmukhi: iriD isiD iniD sB golIAwN swiDk isD rhy lptweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Sabh Goleeaan Saadhik Sidh Rahay Lapataaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All prosperities, miraculous powers and treasures are her servants and many an accomplished person is engrossed in her.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrn iCA drsnw jqI sqI nau nwQ invweI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varan Chhia Darasanaan Jatee Satee Nau Naad Nivaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the four vamas, six philosophies, celebates, suttees and nine maths have been made to bow by her.

lines.gurmukhi: iqMn loA cOdh Bvn jil Qil mhIAl Clu kir CweI
lines.transliteration_english: Tinn Loa Chaudah Bhavan Jali Dali Maheeal Chhalu Kari Chhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Deceptively she is pervading all the three worlds, fourteen abodes, land, sea and the nether worlds.

lines.gurmukhi: kvlwsxu kvlwpqI swDsMgiq srxwgiq AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kavalaa Sanu Kavalaapatee Saadhasangati Saranaagati Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: That goddess Kamala (Laksmi) alongwith her husband (Visnu) seeks the shelter of holy congregation

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie Awpu gvwie n Awpu gxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wherein the gurmukhs bowing at the feet of holy persons have lost their ego and still have kept themselves unnoticed.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu vfI vifAweI ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Vadee Vadiaaee ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: The grandeur of the pleasure-fruit of the gurmukhs is very great.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 bil qoN crn kmlwN dI mihmwN

Shabad OS B.translation: Grandeur of the lotus feet in context with king Bali story

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn rUpI hoie kY bil Cil ACil Awpu ClwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Roopee Hoi Kai Bali Chhali Achhali Aapu Chhalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Assuming the form of Vaman (short statured brahmin) and remaining unsuccessful in beguiling king Bali

lines.gurmukhi: kroN AFweI Driq mMig ipCo dy vf ipMfu vDwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Karaoun Addhaaee Dharati Mangi Pichhon Day Vad Pindu Vadhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He Himself got beguiled. Having asked for two and a half steps of land, Vaman, afterwards enlarged His body.

lines.gurmukhi: duie kruvw kir iqMin loA bil rwjy iPir mgru imxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Karuvaa Kari Tinni Loa Bali Raajay Dhiri Magaru Minaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In two steps He measured all the three worlds and in a half step He measured the body of king Bali.

lines.gurmukhi: surghu cMgw jwix kY rwju pqwl lok dw pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Suragahu Changaa Jaani Kai Raaju Pataal Lok Daa Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Accepting the kingdom of netherworld better than heavens Bali started ruling it.

lines.gurmukhi: bHmw ibsnu mhysu qRY Bgq vCl drvwn sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Trai Bhagati Vachhal Daravaan Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the Lord, in whom subsume Brahma, Visnu and Mahen, becoming lover of His devotees, served as a door keeper of king Bali

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn lK su pwvnw swDsMgiq rj ieC ieCwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Lakh Su Paavanaa Saadhasangati Raj Ichh Ichhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many sacred incarnations like Vaman also have the wish of having the dust of the feet of holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur crn iDAwieAw ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Gur Charan Dhiaaiaa ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: They also contemplate the feet of the Guru in the company of holy ones.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 prsrwm Avqwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Parsu Ram remained devoid of the delight of the lotus feet

lines.gurmukhi: shs bwhu jmdgin Gir hoie prwhuxcwrI AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sahas Baahu Jamadagani Ghari Hoi Paraahounachaaree Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A king named Sahasrbahu came to Jamadagni rishi as a guest.

lines.gurmukhi: kwmDyxu loBwie kY jmdgnY dw isru vFvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaamadhaynu Lobhaai Kai Jamadaganai Daa Siru Vaddhavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing wish-ful-filling cow with the rishi he became greedy and killed Jamdagni.

lines.gurmukhi: iptdI suix kY ryxukw prsrwm DweI kir DwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pitadee Souni Kai Raynoukaa Parasaraam Dhaaee Kari Dhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hearing the wails of Renuka, his mother, Parana Ram came running to her.

lines.gurmukhi: iekIh vwr kroD kir KqRI mwir inKqR gvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ikeeh Vaar Karodh Kari Khatree Maari Nikhatr Gavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming full of anger he cleared this earth of the kshatriyas twenty-one time i.e. he killed all the kashatriyas.

lines.gurmukhi: crx srix PiV aubry dUjY iksY n KVgu aucwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Dharhi Oubaray Doojai Kisai N Kharhagu Ouchaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only those who fell at the feet of Parasu Rim were saved; none else could raise arms against him.

lines.gurmukhi: haumY mwir n skIAw icrMjIv huie Awpu jxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Maari N Sakeeaa Chiranjeev Hui Aapu Janaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He also could not obliterate his ego and though he became chiraiijiv i.e. ever living person,

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl mkrMdu n pwieAw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Makarandu N Paaiaa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: He always made show of his ego and could never receive the pollen of the lotus feet (of Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: 8 rwm cMdR qoN DUVI dw aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: From Ramchandr teachings of dust of feet

lines.gurmukhi: rMg mhl rMg rwg ivic dsrQu kausilAw rlIAwly
lines.transliteration_english: Rang Mahal Rang Rang Vichi Dasaradu Kaousaliaa Raleeaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In their pleasure palace, Daisarath and Kaus'alya were absorbed in their joys.

lines.gurmukhi: mqw mqwiein Awp ivic cwie ceIly Kry suKwly
lines.transliteration_english: Mataa Mataaini Aap Vichi Chaai Chaeelay Kharay Soukhaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In their exultations they were planning as to what should be the name of their son yet to be born.

lines.gurmukhi: Gir AswVY puqu hoie nwau ik DrIAY bwlk bwly
lines.transliteration_english: Ghari Asaarhai Poutu Hoi Naau Ki Dhareeai Baalak Baalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They thought that the name should be Ram Chandr because just reciting the name of Ram

lines.gurmukhi: rwm cMdu nwau lYNidAwN iqMin hiqAw qy hoie inrwly
lines.transliteration_english: Raam Chandu Naau Laindiaan Tinni Hatiaa Tay Hoi Niraalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They would get rid of three killings (embroy and its parents murder).

lines.gurmukhi: rwm rwj prvwx jig sq sMqoK Drm rKvwly
lines.transliteration_english: Raam Raaj Paravaan Jagi Sat Santokh Dharam Rakhavaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Ram Rai (kingdom of Ram) in which truth, contentement and dharma were protected,

lines.gurmukhi: mwieAw ivic audws hoie suxY purwxu bisstu bhwly
lines.transliteration_english: Maaiaa Vichi Udaas Hoi Sounai Puraanu Basisatu Bahaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Was acknowledged throughout the world. Rim remained detached from maya and sitting near Vasisth listened to the tales of th

lines.gurmukhi: rwmwiexu vrqwieAw islw qrI pg Cuih qqkwly
lines.transliteration_english: Raamaainu Varataaiaa Silaa Taree Pag Chhuhi Tatakaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through the Rtimayatt people came to know that the stone (Ahalya) was restored to life by the touch of the feet of Rim.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq pg DUiV inhwly ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Pag Dhoorhi Nihaalay ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: That Ram also fell happy to attain the dust of the congregations of the sadhus (and went to forest to wash the feet of anch

lines.gurmukhi: 9 kiRSn cMdwvqwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Krsnachandravatar

lines.gurmukhi: iksn lY Avqwru jig mhmw dsm skMDu vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Kisan Laiaa Avataaru Jagi Mahamaa Dasam Sakandhu Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tenth chapter of the Bhagavat defines the glory of incarnation of Krsna in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: lIlw clq Acrj kir jogu Bog rs rlIAw mwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Leelaa Chalat Acharaj Kari Jogu Bhogu Ras Raleeaa Maanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He performed many wonderful acts of bhog (merriment) and yoga (renunciation).

lines.gurmukhi: mhw BwrQu krvwieEnu kYro pwNfo kir hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Mahaa Bhaaradu Karavaaiaonu Kairo Paando Kari Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Making Kauravs (sons of Dhrttrastr) and Pandays to fight against each other he further made them wonder struck.

lines.gurmukhi: ieMdRwidk bHmwidkw mihmw imiq imrjwd n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Indraadik Brahamaadikaa Mahimaa Miti Mirajaad N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Indr and Brahma et al. donot know the limits of his grandeur.

lines.gurmukhi: imlIAw thlw vMif kY jig rwjsU rwjy rwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Mileeaa Tahalaa Vandi Kai Jagi Raajasoo Raajay Raanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When Raisfiy was arranged by Yudhisthar, all were alloted their duties.

lines.gurmukhi: mMg leI hir thl eyh pYr Doie crxodku mwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Mang Laee Hari Tahal Ayh Pair Dhoi Charanodaku Maanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Krsna himself tookover the duty of washing of the feet of all so that through this service

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu is\\\\wxY ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Siaanai ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: He could realise the importance of the service of the holy congregation and the Word of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 Avqwr sulB, crn gur durl`B

Shabad OS B.translation: Invocation of Lord is easily available but the feet of Guru are rare ,

lines.gurmukhi: mC rUp Avqwru Dir purKwrQu kir vyd auDwry
lines.transliteration_english: Machh Roop Avataaru Dhari Purakhaaradu Kari Vayd Udhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is said that in the form of (great) fish Vista' incarnated himself and by his valour salvaged the Vedas.

lines.gurmukhi: kCu rUp huie Avqry swgru miQ jig rqn pswry
lines.transliteration_english: Kachhu Roop Hui Avataray Saagaru Madi Jagi Ratan Pasaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then in the form of tortoise he churned the ocean and brought jewels out of it.

lines.gurmukhi: qIjw kir bYrwh rUpu Driq auDwrI dYq sMGwry
lines.transliteration_english: Teejaa Kari Bairaah Roopu Dharati Udhaaree Dait Sanghaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the form of third incarnation Virah, he decimated demons and liberated the earth.

lines.gurmukhi: cauQw kir nrisMG rUpu Asuru mwir piHlwid aubwry
lines.transliteration_english: Chaudaa Kari Narasingh Roopu Asuru Maari Prahilaadi Oubaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: In fourth incarnation he assumed the form of man-lion andeicilling demon (Hiranyakasipu) saved Prahalid.

lines.gurmukhi: ieksY hI bHmMf ivic ds Avqwr ley AhMkwry
lines.transliteration_english: Ikasai Hee Brahamand Vichi Das Avataar Laay Ahankaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Incarnating ten times in this one world Vismi also became egotist.

lines.gurmukhi: kir bHmMf kroiV ijin lUMA lUMA AMdir sMjwry
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Brahamand Karorhi Jini Looa Looa Andari Sanjaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: But, the Lord Oankar who has subsumed crores of worlds

lines.gurmukhi: lK kroiV ievyihAw EAMkwr Akwr svwry
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Karorhi Ivayhiaa Aoankaar Akaar Savaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: In His each trichome has managed myriads of such individuals.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kml gur Agm Apwry ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Gur Agam Apaaray ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Nevertheless, the lotus feet of Guru are unapproachable and beyond all limits.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 crx gur sB qoN sRySt

Shabad OS B.translation: Feet of Guru are the best ones

lines.gurmukhi: swsqR vyd purwx sB suix suix AwKxu AwiK suxwvih
lines.transliteration_english: Saasatr Vayd Puraan Sabh Souni Souni Aakhanu Aakh Sounaavahi.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having listened to the Shastras, Vedas and Puranas people further recite and listen to them.

lines.gurmukhi: rwg nwd sMgIq lK Anhd Duin suix suix gux gwvih
lines.transliteration_english: Raag Naad Sangati Lakh Anahad Dhouni Souni Souni Goun Gaavahi.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of people listen to the rag-nod (musical measures)and the unstrucke melody and sing the same.

lines.gurmukhi: syK nwg lK lomsw Aibgiq giq AMdir ilvlwvih
lines.transliteration_english: Saykh Naag Lakh Lomasaa Abigati Gati Andari Liv Laavahi.

Shabad OS B.translation: SesanEg and millions of Lomas rishis concentrate to know the dynamism of that unmanifest Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: bHmy ibsnu mhys lK igAwnu iDAwnu iqlu AMqu n pwvih
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamo Bisanu Mahays Lakh Giaanu Dhiaanu Tilu Antu N Paavahi.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of Brahma, Visnus and Sivas who concentrate upon and talk of Him, are still ignorant about even an iota of His mys

lines.gurmukhi: dyvI dyv sryvdy AlK AByv n syv pujwvih
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvee Dayv Sarayvaday Alakh Abhayv N Sayv Pujaavahi.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gods and goddesses adore that Lord but their service does not take them to His mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: gorK nwQ mCMdR lK swiDk isiD nyq kir iDAwvih
lines.transliteration_english: Gorakh Naad Machhandr Lakh Saadhik Sidhi Nayt Kari Dhiaavahi.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of Machhendr nths (Matsyendranath), Gorakhnaths and the siddhs (the ascetics of high orders) concentrate upon Him through their yogic practices (of dhautr and neti etc).

lines.gurmukhi: crx kml guru Agm Alwvih ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Guru Agam Alaavahi ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: They all declare the feet of Guru as unapproachable

lines.gurmukhi: 12 aUc Awdr Xog nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: The higher one is alone is not respectable

lines.gurmukhi: mQY iqvVI bwmxY sauhy Awey msliq PyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Madai Tivarhee Baamanai Sauhay Aaay Masalati Dhayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: If going out doors one comes across a brahmin (who is proud of his high caste in India), the traditional people consider it

lines.gurmukhi: isru aucw AhMkwr kir vl dy pg vlwey fyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Siru Ouchaa Ahankaar Kari Val Day Pag Valaaay Dayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The head being proud of its high place is tied with turban.

lines.gurmukhi: AKIN mUil n pUjIAin kir kir vyKin myrI qyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Akheen Mooli N Poojeeani Kari Kari Vaykhani Mayree Tayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eyes are also not adored because they see with the sense of duality.

lines.gurmukhi: nku n koeI pUjdw Kwie mroVI mxI GnyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Naku N Koee Poojadaa Khaai Marorhee Manee Ghanayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nose is also not worshipped because on seeing a low person the nose is turned up to show disdain.

lines.gurmukhi: aucy kMn n pUjIAin ausqiq inMdw BlI BlyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Ouchay Kann N Poojeeani Ousatati Nidaa Bhalee Bhalayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though placed higher, the ears are also not worshipped because they listen to the eulogy as well as slander.

lines.gurmukhi: bolhu jIB n pUjIAY rs ks bhu cKI dMd GyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Bolahu Jeebh N Poojeeai Ras Kas Bahu Chakhee Dandi Ghayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tongue is also not worshipped because it is also surrounded by teeth and tastes both edibles and inedibles.

lines.gurmukhi: nIvy crx pUj hQ kyrI ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Neevayn Charan Pooj Had Kayree ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only because of being the lowest, the feet are touched with hands in worshipful reverence.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 b`krI dy AlMkwr qoN aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Lesson from Goat

lines.gurmukhi: hsiq AKwju gumwn kir sIhu sqwxw koie n KweI
lines.transliteration_english: Hasati Akhaaju Goumaan Kari Seehu Sataanaa Koi N Khaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The proud elephant is inedible and none eats the mighty lion.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie inmwxI bkrI dIn dunI vifAweI pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Nimaanee Bakaree Deen Dounee Vadiaaee Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Goat is humble and hence it is respected everywhere.

lines.gurmukhi: mrxY prxY mMnIAY jig Boig prvwxu krweI
lines.transliteration_english: Maranai Paranai Manneeai Jagi Bhogi Paravaanu Karaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: On occasions of death, joy, marriage, yajna, etc only its meat dis accepted.

lines.gurmukhi: mwsu pivqR giHsq no AwNdhu qwr vIcwir vjweI
lines.transliteration_english: Maasu Pavitr Grihasat No Aandahu Taar Veechaari Vajaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among the householders its meat is acknowledged as sacred and with its gut stringed instruments are made.

lines.gurmukhi: cmVy dIAw kir juqIAw swDU crx srix ilvlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Chamarhay Deeaan Kari Jouteeaa Saadhoo Charan Sarani Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From its leather the shoes are made to be used by the saints merged in their meditation upon the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: qUr pKwvj mVIdy kIrqnu swDsMgiq suKdweI
lines.transliteration_english: Toor Pakhaavaj Marheeday Keeratanu Saadhasangati Soukhadaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Drums are mounted by its skin and then in the holy congregation the delight-giving kirtan, eulogy of the Lord, is sung.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq siqgur srxweI ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Satigur Saranaaee ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: In fact, going to the holy congregation is the same as going to the shelter of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 mwxs dyhI

Shabad OS B.translation: Human body

lines.gurmukhi: sB srIr AkwrQy Aiq ApivqR su mwxs dyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Sareer Sakaaraday Ati Apavitr Su Maanas Dayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the bodies are useful but the human body is the most useless and defiled one.

lines.gurmukhi: bhu ibMjn imstwn pwn huie ml mUqR ksUqR ievyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Bahu Binjan Misataan Paan Hui Mal Mootr Kousootr Ivayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In its company many a delicious food, sweet etc change into urine and faeces.

lines.gurmukhi: pwt ptMbr ivgVdy pwn kpUr kusMg snyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Paat Patanbar Vigarhaday Paan Kapoor Kousang Sanayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In its evil company silken robes, betel, comphor etc. also get spoiled.

lines.gurmukhi: coAw cMdnu Argjw huie durgMD sugMD huryhI
lines.transliteration_english: Choaa Chandanu Aragajaa Hui Duragandh Sougandh Hurayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sandal scent, and joss sticks etc also get converted into fowl smell.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjy rwj kmwNvdy pwiqswh Kih muey sBy hI
lines.transliteration_english: Raajay Raaj Kamaanvaday Paatisaah Khahi Muay Sabhay Hee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Kings rule gheir kingdoms and die of their fights with one another.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq guru srix ivxu inhPl mwxs dyh ievyhI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Guru Sarani Vinu Nihaphalu Maanas Dayh Ivayhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Withoug going to the holy congregation and to the shelter of Guru, this human body is also fruitless.

lines.gurmukhi: crn srix mskInI jyhI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Masakeenee Jayhee ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only that body is meaningful which has come to the Guru's fold in humility

lines.gurmukhi: 15 BgqwN dy nwm

Shabad OS B.translation: Names of the devotees--bhagats

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu pwieAw swDsMgiq gursrxI Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paaiaa Saadhasangati Gur Saranee Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those gurmukhs who have gone into the shelter of the holy congretation have attained the pleasure fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: DRU piHlwdu vKwxIAin AMbrIku bil Bgiq sbwey
lines.transliteration_english: Dhr Prahilaad Vakhaaneeani Anbareeku Bali Bhagati Sabaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: These devotees are Dhruv, Prahalad, Ambaris, Bali, Janak, Jaidev, Valmilci et al.

lines.gurmukhi: snkwidk jYdyau jig bwlmIku siqsMg qrwey
lines.transliteration_english: Janakaadik Jaidayu Jagi Baalameeku Satisangi Taraaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They have gone across through the holy congregation. Bent, Trilochan, Namdev, Dhanna,

lines.gurmukhi: byxu iqlocnu nwmdyau DMnw sDnw Bgq sdwey
lines.transliteration_english: Baynu Tilochanu Naamadayu Dhannaa Sadhanaa Bhagat Sadaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sadhana have also been called saints. Kabir is accepted as bhagat, the devotee, and Ravidas,

lines.gurmukhi: Bgqu kbIr vKwxIAY jn rivdwsu ibdr guru Bwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagatu Kabeeru Vakhaaneeai Jan Ravidaasu Bidar Guru Bhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Vidur et al. have also been loved by the Lord. Whether born in high or the low caste,

lines.gurmukhi: jwiq Ajwiq snwiq ivic gurmuiK crx kvl icqu lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jaati Ajaati Sanaati Vichi Guramoukhi Charan Kaval Chitu Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh who has adopted the lotus feet in his heart,

lines.gurmukhi: haumY mwrI pRgtI Awey ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Maaree Pragatee Aaay ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Decimating his ego has come to be known (as devotee).

lines.gurmukhi: 16 ihMdU muslmwnwN dI PkV

Shabad OS B.translation: Fruitilty of Hindus and muslims

lines.gurmukhi: lok vyd suix AwKdw suix suix igAwnI igAwnu vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lok Vayd Souni Aakhadaa Souni Souni Giaanee Giaanu Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The so - called knowledgeable persons having listened to the Vedas as their knowledge about the world on the basis of hears

lines.gurmukhi: surg lok sxu mwq lok suix suix swq pqwlu n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Surag Lok Sanu Maat Lok Souni Souni Saat Pataalu Naa Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  also learn about heavens, mother earth and all the seven odds, but still they donot know the real truth.

lines.gurmukhi: BUq BivK n vrqmwn Awid miD AMq hoey hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhoot Bhavikh N Varatamaan Aadi Madhi Ant Hoay Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Neither do they hand the past future and the present, nor the mystery of the beginning middle, but are simply wonderstruck

lines.gurmukhi: auqm mDm nIc hoie smiJ n skix coj ivfwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Outam Madham Neech Hoi Samajhi N Sakani Choj Vidaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through their classifications medium and low varnas they cannot understand the great play.

lines.gurmukhi: rj gux qm gux AwKIAY siq gux sux AwKwx vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Raj Goun Tam Goun Aakheeai Sati Goun Soun Aakhaan Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Engrossed in actions (rajoguni), inertia (tamoguni) and tranquillity (satoguni) also talk and listen,

lines.gurmukhi: mn bc krm is Brmdy swDsMgiq siqgur n is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Man Bach Karam Si Bharamaday Saadh Sangati Satigur N Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: But without understanding the holy nation and the true Guru, they wander through the activities of their eech and actions.

lines.gurmukhi: PkV ihMdU muslmwxY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Dhakarhu Hindoo Mousalamaanai ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus the (classifications of) Muslims and Hindus

lines.gurmukhi: 17 ju`gwN dy Drm

Shabad OS B.translation: Duties of the yugs --the Time periods

lines.gurmukhi: siqjuig ieku ivgwVdw iqsu ipCY PiV dysu pIVwey
lines.transliteration_english: Satijougi Iku Vigaarhadaa Tisu Pichhai Dharhi Daysu Peerhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the Satyug the whole country suffered because of the evil deeds of one wrong-doer.

lines.gurmukhi: qRyqY ngrI vglIAY duAwpir vMsu nrik shmwey
lines.transliteration_english: Traytai Nagaree Vagaleeai Duaapari Vansu Naraki Sahamaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Tretia the whole city was surrounded and in Dvapar, the whole family was to suffer hell.

lines.gurmukhi: jo PyVY so PVIdw kiljug scw inAwau krwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jo Dhayrhai So Dharheedaa Kalijougi Sachaa Niaau Karaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The justice of Kaliyug is true because only he suffers who does the evil deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: siqjug squ qRyqY jugw duAwpir pUjw cwir idVwey
lines.transliteration_english: Satijoug Satu Traytai Jougaa Duaapari Poojaa Chaari Dirhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Satyug, the truth, in Treta- the yajti, in Dvapar ritualistic worship were accomplished.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljuig nwau ArwDxw hor krm kir mukiq n pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Naau Araadhanaa Hor Karam Kari Moukati N Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Kaliyug through no action other than constant remembering the Lord's name could attain liberation.

lines.gurmukhi: juig juig luxIAY bIijAw pwpu puMnu kir duK suK pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jougi Jougi Louneeai Beejiaa Paapu Pounnu Kari Doukh Soukh Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In all the yugs (ages) the individual reaps what he has sown and earns sufferings and delights in accordance with his demer

lines.gurmukhi: kiljuig icqvY puMn Pl pwphu lypu ADrmu kmwey
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijougi Chitavai Pounn Phal Paapahu Laypu Adharam Kamaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Kaliyug, the individual desires to have the fruits of meritorious actions though he remains absorbed in the sinful deeds

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu Awpu gvwey ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Aapu Gavaaay ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs attain the pleasure fruit only by losing their sense of ego

lines.gurmukhi: 18 Drm Daul dw AlMkwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of the Dharma Bull

lines.gurmukhi: sqjug dw AinAwau vyiK Daul Drm hoAw aufIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Satajoug Daa Aniaau Vaykhi Dhaul Dharamu Hoaa Udeenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing the injustice of Satyug, dharma in the form of a bull got sad.

lines.gurmukhi: surpiq nrpiq ckY riK n hMGin bl miq hIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Surapati Narapati Chakravai Rakhi N Hanghani Bal Mati Heenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the king of gods, Indr, and other kings with vast empires, engrossed egoism, devoid of power and wisdom could not sust

lines.gurmukhi: qRyqy iKisAw pYru ieku hom jg jug Qwip pqIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Traytay Khisiaa Pairu Iku Hom Jag Jagu Daapi Pateenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Treta- its one foot slipped and now religious people started feeling satisfied by mere performance of the ceremonies of

lines.gurmukhi: duAwpuir duie pg Drm dy pUjw cwr pKMfu AlIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Duaapuri Dui Pag Dharam Day Poojaa Chaar Pakhandu Aleenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Dvapar remained only two feet of dharma and now people began to remain absorbed only ritualistic worship.

lines.gurmukhi: kiljug rihAw pYr ieku hoie inmwxw Drm ADIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Kalijoug Rahiaa Pair Iku Hoi Nimaanaa Dharam Adheenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In Kaliyug, the dharma has only one feet and consequently has become quite feeble.

lines.gurmukhi: mwxu inmwxY siqgurU swDsMgiq prgt prbIxw
lines.transliteration_english: Maanu Nimaanai Satiguroo Saadhasangati Paragat Parabeenaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: True Guru, the power of the powerless, has made it (dharma) manifest by and through creating the holy Icongretgations.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK Drm spUrxu rIxw ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukh Dharam Sapooranu Reenaa ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs have brought to perfection the dharma earlier reduced to dust.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 gurmuK pMQ

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh-wayfarer

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrn iek vrn kir vrn Avrn swDsMgu jwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varani Ik Varani Kari Varan Avaran Saadhasangu Jaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Since the true Guru integrated all the four varnas into one, this assemblage of varnas has come to be known as the holy con

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruqI iCA drsnw gurmuiK drsnu sUrju QwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routee Chhia Darasanaa Guramoukhi Darasanu Sooraju Daapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among six seasons and six philosophies, the Gurmukh-philosophy has been established like the Sun (among the planets).

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh pMQ imtwie kY gurmuiK pMQ vfw prqwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Pand Mitaai Kai Guramoukhi Pand Vadaa Parataapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wiping out all the twelve ways (of yogis) the Guru has created the mighty Gurmukh-way (panth).

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqybhu bwhrw Anhd sbdu AgMm AlwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Kataybahu Baaharaa Anahad Sabadu Aganm Alaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: This panth keeps itself away from the boundaries of the Vedas and the Katebas and always remembers as well as sings the uns

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie gurisKw rhrwis pCwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Gurasikhaa Raharaasi Pachhaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: On this Way of absolute humility and becoming dust of the feet of the Gum, the disciple learns the right conduct.

lines.gurmukhi: mwieAw ivic audws kir Awpu gvwey jpY AjwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Kari Aapu Gavaaay Japai Ajaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: This panth remains detached amidst maya and obliterating the sense of ego remembers the Lord spontaneously i.e. always rema

lines.gurmukhi: lMG inkQY vrY srwpY ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Lagh Nikadai Varai Saraapai ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: It has gone far beyond the influence of boons and curses.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 rwjw rMk brwbr

Shabad OS B.translation: The King and the poor are equal

lines.gurmukhi: imldy muslmwn duie imil imil krin slwmwlykI
lines.transliteration_english: Miladay Mousalamaan Dui Mili Mili Karani Salaamaalaykee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When two Muslims meet they greet each other by saying `Salam' (salamalaikum).

lines.gurmukhi: jogI krin Adys imil Awid purKu Awdysu ivsyKI
lines.transliteration_english: Jogee Karani Adays Mili Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Visaykhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When yogis meet they exchange Wes" salute to that ,primaeval Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: sMinAwsI kir Enmo Enm nwrwiex bhu ByKI
lines.transliteration_english: Sanniaasee Kari Aonamo Aonam Naaraain Bahu Bhaykhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sannyasis of different garbs say 'On namah', 'om namah narayanah'.

lines.gurmukhi: bwmHx no kir nmskwr kir AwsIr vcn muhu dyKI
lines.transliteration_english: Baamhan No Kari Namasakaar Kari Aaseer Vadan Muhu Daykhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When one bows before a brahmin, he also in view of the station of the person gives blessings accordingly.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pvxw siqgurU gur isKw rhrwis sryKI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pavanaa Satiguroo Gur Sikhaa Raharaasi Saraykhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among the Sikhs, on meeting, the tradition of salulation by touching feet is there, and this is the best one.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjw rMku brwbrI bwlk ibriD n Bydu inmyKI
lines.transliteration_english: Raajaa Ranku Baraabaree Baalak Biradhi N Bhaydu Nimaykhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In this act the king and the poor are equal and no distinction of young and old is observed.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn Bgqw rUp n ryKI ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Bhagataa Roop N Raykhee ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: The devotees like sandal wood make no discrimination (while spreading their fragrance).

lines.gurmukhi: 21 inMmRqw dy diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Examples of humilty

lines.gurmukhi: nIchu nIcu sdwvxw gur aupdysu kmwvY koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Neechahu Neechu Sadaavanaa Gur Oupadaysu Kamaavai Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare one practises the Guru's teaching of calling oneself the lowest among the lowly ones.

lines.gurmukhi: qRY vIhwN dy dMm lY ieku rupeIAw hoCw hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Trai Veehaan Day Danm Lai Iku Roupaeeaa Hochhaa Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When a rupee is changed into sixty paisas, its power is scattered and it becames weak.

lines.gurmukhi: dsI rupXIN leIdw ieku suneIAw haulw soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Dasee Roupayeen Laeedaa Iku Sounaeeaa Haulaa Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If gold-muhar (coin) is changed for ten rupees, it loses its value.

lines.gurmukhi: shs suneIey mulu kir lXY hIrw hwr proeI
lines.transliteration_english: Sahas Sounaeeay Mulu Kari Layai Heeraa Haar Paroee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And if a diamond is obtained for one thousand coins, it becomes so light that it is stringed in a necklace (and is worn).

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie mn bc krm Brm Bau KoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Man Bach Karam Bharam Bhau Khoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The man who by touching the feet and by becoming dust of the feet (of Guru) erases the illusions and fears of speech

lines.gurmukhi: hoie pMcwiexu pMij mwr bwhir jwNdw riK sgoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Panchaainu Panji Maar Baahari Jaadaa Rakhi Sagoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And actions from his mind and in the holy congregation wipes out the five evil propensities, he further restrains the mind

lines.gurmukhi: bol Abolu swD jn EeI ]21]23]
lines.transliteration_english: Bol Abolu Saadh Jan Aoee ?21?23?trayee?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a one is a real sadhu (Gurmukh) and his words are ineffable.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satiguru Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Onkaar,the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: drsn joiq n joqI srUp huie pqMg sbd suriq miRg jugiq n jwnI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Darasan Joti N Jotee Saroop Hui Patanga , Sabad Surati Mrig Jougati N Jaanee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a moth, I do not sacrifice myself over the radiant glimpse True Guru, nor do I know the method of lodging the music of True Guru's words as is the wont of a deer;

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml mkrMd n mDup giq ibrh ibEg huie n mIn mir jwnY hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Makarand N Madhoup Gati , Birah Biaog Hui N Meen Mari Jaanai Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a bumble bee mad for the nectar of lotus flower loses his life when the flower closes, but I have not sacrificed myself unto the lotus like feet of my Satguru, nor have Known the pangs of separation from my Satguru like a fish when out of water;

lines.gurmukhi: eyk eyk tyk n trq hY qiRgd join cwqur cqr gun hoie n ihrwnY hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ayk Ayk Tayk N Tarat Hai Trigad Joni , Chaatur Chatar Goun Hoi N Hiraanai Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The living being of lower species do not backtrack their steps dying for their love that is based on just one virtue. But I with all my wisdom do not carry any trait like these beings, I do not sacrifice myself unto my True Guru creatures do;

lines.gurmukhi: pwhn kTor siqgur suK swgr mY suin mm nwm jm nrk ljwnY hY ]23]
lines.transliteration_english: Paahan Katthor Satigur Soukh Saagar Mai , Souni Mam Naam Jam Narak Lajaanai Hai ?23?

Shabad OS B.translation: Satguru is ocean of peace and tranquillity but I am like a stone (who is least influenced by any precept of the True Guru) despite living near Him. Hearing the name of a sinner like the messenger of hell would feel ashamed of me. (23)
